//Introduction
By default, the app will sound an alarm once the battery is full.\n\n
You can change the battery alarm level in the settings menu.
It helps you extend your battery lifespan by avoiding overcharging of battery.\n\n
Research from battery university has shown an increase in the battery lifespan by up to 200%, if not overcharged.
Battery Monitor\n Accurate charging and discharging status
Flashlight\n Toggle flashlight using torch on/off button
Low Battery Notification\n It reminds you once your battery level is low. Can be customized in settings.
High Temp. Warning\n Notifies once the battery temperature is high.
Garbage cleanup Process clean up Useless installation package Temporary Files Log file Cache trash System cache Recommended to clean up Clean up

How to use
Theft Alarm :\n
A.To use theft alarm, connect the mobile charger and click on ‘Theft Alarm’.\n B.You will then be asked to enter a password. This is a one-time activity.\n C.After successfully configuring the password, the theft alarm will be activated.\n D.Now if the phone is unplugged, an alarm will sound and will only stop by inserting the correct password.\n\n
Full Battery Alarm – \n
A.Once the application is installed, full battery alarm is activated.\n B.While charging, once the battery is fully charged at 100%, the app will sound an alarm which can be stopped by either clicking the dismiss alarm button or by unplugging the charger.
